section1.problem: The problem for this project was to create an interaction using sound as an input to create a fun interaction for the user.
section1.solution: Amongst ideas like a cat game operated by meows, a cricket game operated through well timed clicking noises and a humming salad bar, I went for a fun user-friendly idea to see what kind of recipes my instructors and peers would generate.

section2.summary: This page is a complete report for my HCI II course at the University of Calgary where I built a responsive humming app that generates a salad bowl based on the user's humming. The user can also select their food preferences and the app will generate a salad bowl based on the user's preferences. The user can also view the recipe for the salad bowl.
section2.designRemarks: I have used a light-green background and comic sans (I apologize) to highlight the playfulness and the environment.
lessonsLearned: Randomness should be minimum to reduce the sense of wonder and create a need to try different songs to hum, pitches to hum at.
Implementation of concepts from the sketches would've been a very creative and fun addition to the website.
